Well, it started out as a fuel tank with wings, but i got carried away.

I apologize for any grief endured while trying to fly my ship, or simply looking at it, and in my defense, still don't know half of the game's parts, and probably more than 70% of the hot keys.

Thus, i present the F-1337 Ridiculous:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Basically, a jet bomber booster-er

How to use:

1- Activate SAS, really, you won't make it manually.

2- Press S until the plane sits back (the wheels everything will break explode if you try to take off normally)

3- Press 1 to start the engines. Don't press space.

4- It flies!

5- Press 2 to drop the missile, normally, it will decouple from the plane and drop the jet. (and obviously, ignite)

6- Press 3 to ignite the middle jet engine. Don't use it while the missile is still attached because it will throw you off even more off balance.

Download here

What do you think of it?

If i figure out how to make a bigger plane that doesn't wobble (and flies), i might adapt it for a large booster.

Also, this is my first post, so

Hello

Edit: Updated, more unstable maneuverable (with the missile), takes off vertically. Press 1 to ignite engines, 2 to launch missile, 3 to get rid of the legs.

Nice job! I still can't make anything useful in the plane hanger

To avoid wobble, strut your stuff. Hehe, play on words...I amuse me. Anyway, to avoid wobble, just make sure to strut everything. The struts weigh squat so don't worry about that and if you zoom in you can put the struts inside stuff so you don't see them everywhere. Also, nice first craft, mine was more a kerban execution device...

To avoid wobble, strut your stuff.

Or, if you, like me, hate struts (because they're useless parts that only do something that shouldn't be necessary in the first place), grab the Kerbal Joint Reinforcement mod. It adds no parts, and all it does is help your craft not unexpectedly disassemble itself on launch or load, and reinforces attachments between parts.

Barring that, spam struts like everyone else

Also really good job. Especially if that was the first thing you ever made in the game. I think my first craft ever was a command pod, a tiny fuel tank, and an LV-T30. And that flew approximately like a washing machine.

I've also noticed that with my planes, wobble on the runway comes from either angled or misaligned landing gear. Like if your landing gear on the front is 5 degrees off straight your plane will always twist and crash before takeoff. Holding SHIFT while you rotate stuff can help with fine tuning that.
